title: Can we commend Riot for a second?
body:
I don't come to boards often but I saw the front page and it looks like people are bashing riot left and right for stuff. 

Can we commend riot for some things they've done from season 6/early season 7 though?? 

**1) SOLO QUEUE**
Yeah, they brought it back boys. I know, autofill is annoying but honestly I get autofilled like less than 5% of my games. I also enjoy support so theres that. Loving SoloQ. 


**2) Hextech Crafting**
Ok, I for one LOVE hextech crafting. Legit I had 0 skins before and didn't care for them. But through hextech crafting I got skins I would NEVER get in my life (like blood moon thresh, spirit guard udyr) and it makes the game SO much more enjoyable and lets broke people have some skins too :). I look forward to playing champs i have skins for, and sometimes I only play a champ cuz i got a badass skin for it.

**3) Rotating Game Modes**

Not ALWAYS the best, but they're actually enjoyable a lot of the time. Its the perfect way to keep URF and All-For-One keep coming without them getting stale. There are improvements to be made but the idea is spectacular

**4) PRETTY GOOD BALANCE**
People say Lucian is OP, Graves is OP... ok maybe they're _strong_ but nothing is as OP as the shit you saw last season (for LONG periods of time)

**Tank Ekko:** Build sunfire then just go dive every lane you please. Late game just split push and chase any squishy down to their nexus if they dare to even look at you from a mile away. Oh, you wanna gank him or 5 man him? Nvm hes gonna slow you all and get a movespeed buff. Oh yeah and hes super tanky too haha. Oh and teamfights you just stun people for 2.25 secs and half life everyone while taking 0 damage. Bad engage? Press R man! 59-60% w/r

**Lucian:** You built ghostblade? Ok, you can now 1v2 bot lane. Not even kidding. I used to build ghostblade, hide in a bush and just 1 shot the adc, and then kill support too. JG shows up? Lul kill his ass too. 56-57% w/r

**Jungle s6:** Oh guys we're 27-0 this should be an easy game. **Yi whos been power farming for 35 mins shows up**. Oh shit guys he has 3.5K hp with devourer and rageblade run before he 1shots our whole team. (Enemy Pentakill). 

**Jungle s7:** Oh shit guys lee sin is level 7 while bot lane is level 4. (Dove). Well guess i got outplayed there :) (fixed XP in jg)

Honorable mentions: Zed (after QSS), Kog'Maw (reverted), Malz (after mage rework, now gutted), Yasuo (triforce build).

I know a lot of these fk ups are riot-created, but these shit plagued all of Season 6. Like there wasn't a week where something wasn't busted a shit.

_Right now some champions are in the gutter, sure, BUT I'd rather have 10 champs in the gutter than 10 champs broken as shit while other champs are balanced_

**Honorable Mentions:**
Replays
Sandbox mode (could be improved, ofc)
New skins are super cool and make me excited (project ashe, dark star thresh, god fist lee sin)

You really think it's his passive? I think it's his dash, personally. He's an extremely mobile marksman, a role that's supposed to be a powerhouse carry yet also fragile. In Lucian's case, his dash (how easily and often it comes up) mitigates and reduces his weaknesses, sometimes even negating them. He doesn't need to depend on his team due to his mobility compared to other carries.

He already has pretty low range as it is. It's just his dash that nulls it.

The funny thing is that the OP is seeing it as a good thing that Lucian with ghostblade was corrected, when in reality, it was just a mistake fixed. It would've been better if Riot simply didn't make that mistake in the first place. In fact, if the community didn't criticise Lucian for being OP then Riot probably would've never fixed it.

Here's the thing: Nobody really knew how powerful it was for a long time. Remember when Flat Arpen Lucian was called Korean Build Lucian, because it was a build that was found mostly in Korean Solo Queue? There were no immediate buffs or changes to either champ/item bringing in that build, it was random discovery. You're expecting Riot to have the foresight to know that a side abuse build completely ignored for about a year will be crazy OP without anyone knowing, and that's a little much.

This, basically. There's an effectively infinite possible combinations of champions and builds for any one player. A given game has _10_ players, but even that's not all of it. Every build is affected by what else is popular and what's expected, which all in turn effect each other, meaning something that has fairly reasonable numbers overall can be extremely broken simply because none of its counters work well with/against everything else that's popular atm. That's all a meta is: expectations and the play around those expectations.

By way of example, in a heavy tank/armor meta, the lethality meta would never've happened. When the other side has three 300 armor tanks, your 20 armor pen isn't nearly as effective as it is vs. a team of squishies with 40 armor.

Telling Riot what they think in a considerate and non-emotional way is a good thing, I don't think that mr. Skins Project is arguing against that.

This however, is not to be confused with bashing. Bashing is more akin to yelling than discussing. You just got out of a game where you got stomped by X champion, so you go onto the boards and make a thread telling Riot all the ways they've screwed up and how they are the worst company in existence, etc. This sort of post is not focused on providing feedback, its focused on the OP blaming their in-game problems on Riot because it makes them feel better about themselves. Riot not only shouldn't, but **CAN'T** take anything meaningful away from that post.

(also as a side note, personally attacking the person you're trying to talk to is really disrespectful and is also a concession of the argument itself, as you're effectively saying "I can't think of a way to counter your point so I'll just call you names instead", along those lines, it's also somewhat childish to show such hostility towards a person you don't even know just because they disagree with you)

There is a difference between both, the problem is that fanboys of products lump those in together, in LOL included. I have seen far too much fully detailed critisism called bashing.
